cards.name: Alpine Moon
cards.text:
As Alpine Moon enters the battlefield, choose a nonbasic land card name.
Lands your opponents control with the chosen name lose all land types and abilities, and they gain "{T}: Add one mana of any color."
cards.flavor:
"A rare and fascinating phenomenon."
—Tamiyo

rulings.text: Alpine Moon's effect doesn't affect supertypes or other card types. It won't remove the artifact card type from an artifact land or remove the legendary supertype from a legendary land.
If an affected land has an ability that triggers "when" it enters the battlefield, it will lose that ability before it triggers.

If an affected land has an ability that causes it to enter the battlefield tapped, it will lose that ability before it applies. The same is also true of any other abilities that modify how a land enters the battlefield or apply "as" a land enters the battlefield.

cards.originalText:
As Alpine Moon enters the battlefield, choose a nonbasic land card name.
Lands your opponents control with the chosen name lose all land types and abilities, and they gain "{T}: Add one mana of any color."

cards.name: Apex of Power
cards.text:
Exile the top seven cards of your library. Until end of turn, you may cast nonland cards exiled this way.
If this spell was cast from your hand, add ten mana of any one color.
cards.flavor:
"As I desire, so it shall be."
—Nicol Bolas

rulings.text: Apex of Power doesn't change when you can cast the exiled cards. For example, if you exile a sorcery card, you can cast it only during your main phase when the stack is empty.
Casting an exiled card causes it to leave exile. You can't cast it multiple times.
Any cards not cast, including land cards, remain in exile.
If an effect copies Apex of Power, the copy wasn't cast at all, so you won't add ten mana.

cards.originalText:
Exile the top seven cards of your library. Until end of turn, you may cast nonland cards exiled this way.
If this spell was cast from your hand, add ten mana of any one color.

cards.name: Banefire
cards.text:
Banefire deals X damage to any target.
If X is 5 or more, this spell can't be countered and the damage can't be prevented.
cards.flavor: For Sarkhan Vol, the dragon is the purest expression of life's savage splendor.

rulings.text: To determine whether it can be countered and its damage can be prevented, Banefire checks the number you chose for X, not the amount of mana you actually spent or the amount of damage it will actually deal.

Banefire can be targeted by spells that try to counter it regardless of what the value of X is. If X is 5 or more, those spells will still resolve, but the part of their effect that would counter Banefire won't do anything. Any other effects those spells have will work as normal.
If its target is illegal by the time Banefire tries to resolve, the spell isn't countered, but it doesn't resolve. The target won't be dealt damage.

cards.originalText:
Banefire deals X damage to any target.
If X is 5 or more, this spell can't be countered and the damage can't be prevented.

cards.name: Boggart Brute
cards.text: Menace (This creature can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)
cards.flavor: He has the biggest bashing stick, so it's a safe bet he's the leader.

rulings.text: Once an attacking creature with menace is legally blocked by two or more creatures, removing one or more of those blockers from combat won't change or undo that block.

cards.originalText: Menace (This creature can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)

cards.name: Catalyst Elemental
cards.text: Sacrifice Catalyst Elemental: Add {R}{R}.
cards.flavor: As the hyperstormic generator crept past redline, a being emerged from the arc.
cards.originalText: Sacrifice Catalyst Elemental: Add {R}{R}.

cards.name: Crash Through
cards.text:
Creatures you control gain trample until end of turn. (A creature with trample can deal excess combat damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.)
Draw a card.

rulings.text: Crash Through affects only creatures you control at the time it resolves. Creatures you begin to control later in the turn won't gain trample.
You may cast Crash Through even if you control no creatures. If you control no creatures as the spell resolves, you'll just draw a card.

cards.originalText: Creatures you control gain trample until end of turn. (A creature with trample can deal excess combat damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.) Draw a card.

cards.name: Dark-Dweller Oracle
cards.text: {1}, Sacrifice a creature: Exile the top card of your library. You may play that card this turn. (You still pay its costs. You can play a land this way only if you have an available land play remaining.)
cards.flavor: Eyes are unnecessary for seeing the future.

rulings.text: Dark-Dweller Oracle doesn't change when you can cast the exiled card. For example, if you exile a sorcery card, you can cast it only during your main phase when the stack is empty. If you exile a land card, you can play it only during your main phase and only if you have an available land play remaining.
Casting an exiled card causes it to leave exile. You can't cast it multiple times.
If you don't cast the exiled card, it remains in exile.
You can sacrifice Dark-Dweller Oracle to pay the cost for its own ability.

cards.originalText: {1}, Sacrifice a creature: Exile the top card of your library. You may play that card this turn. (You still pay its costs. You can play a land this way only if you have an available land play remaining.)

cards.name: Demanding Dragon
cards.text:
Flying
When Demanding Dragon enters the battlefield, it deals 5 damage to target opponent unless that player sacrifices a creature.
cards.flavor: A knight's devotion to their steed goes only so far.
cards.originalText:
Flying
When Demanding Dragon enters the battlefield, it deals 5 damage to target opponent unless that player sacrifices a creature.

cards.name: Dismissive Pyromancer
cards.text:
{R}, {T}, Discard a card: Draw a card.
{2}{R}, {T}, Sacrifice Dismissive Pyromancer: It deals 4 damage to target creature.
cards.flavor: "Burn. Burn. Keep. Burn."
cards.originalText:
{R}, {T}, Discard a card: Draw a card. 
{2}{R}, {T}, Sacrifice Dismissive Pyromancer: It deals 4 damage to target creature.

cards.name: Doublecast
cards.text: When you cast your next instant or sorcery spell this turn, copy that spell. You may choose new targets for the copy.
cards.flavor: First the insult, then the encore.

rulings.text: If you cast one Doublecast after another, you'll copy the second Doublecast. Each resolves, creating two delayed triggered abilities. The next spell you cast after that will be copied twice. If that spell is also a Doublecast, the following spell will be copied three times, and so on.
Doublecast's ability will copy any instant or sorcery spell, not just one with targets.
A copy is created even if the spell that caused Doublecast's ability to trigger has been countered by the time that ability resolves. The copy resolves before the original spell.

The copy will have the same targets as the spell it's copying unless you choose new ones. You may change any number of the targets, including all of them or none of them. The new targets must be legal.
If the spell that's copied is modal (that is, it says "Choose one —" or the like), the copy will have the same mode or modes. You can't choose different ones.
If the spell that's copied has an X whose value was determined as it was cast, the copy has the same value of X.

You can't choose to pay any additional costs for the copy. However, effects based on any additional costs that were paid for the original spell are copied as though those same costs were paid for the copy too.
The copy that Doublecast's ability creates is created on the stack, so it's not "cast." Abilities that trigger when a player casts a spell won't trigger.

cards.originalText: When you cast your next instant or sorcery spell this turn, copy that spell. You may choose new targets for the copy.

cards.name: Dragon Egg
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
When Dragon Egg dies, create a 2/2 red Dragon creature token with flying and "{R}: This creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn."
cards.flavor: Dragon birth lairs are littered with treasure to entice the young from their eggs.
cards.originalText: Defender (This creature can't attack.) When Dragon Egg dies, create a 2/2 red Dragon creature token with flying and "{R}: This creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn."

cards.name: Electrify
cards.text: Electrify deals 4 damage to target creature.
cards.flavor: "Some hid from the storm. I embraced it and learned its name."
cards.originalText: Electrify deals 4 damage to target creature.

cards.name: Fiery Finish
cards.text: Fiery Finish deals 7 damage to target creature.
cards.flavor: Negotiations reached an abrupt conclusion.
cards.originalText: Fiery Finish deals 7 damage to target creature.

cards.name: Fire Elemental
cards.flavor: It treads on feet of coals and strikes with the force of a volcano.

cards.name: Goblin Instigator
cards.text: When Goblin Instigator enters the battlefield, create a 1/1 red Goblin creature token.
cards.flavor: "We can take 'em. You go first!"
cards.originalText: When Goblin Instigator enters the battlefield, create a 1/1 red Goblin creature token.

cards.name: Goblin Motivator
cards.text: {T}: Target creature gains haste until end of turn. (It can attack and {T} this turn.)
cards.flavor: Small words stoke large flames.
cards.originalText: {T}: Target creature gains haste until end of turn. (It can attack and {T} this turn.)

cards.name: Goblin Trashmaster
cards.text:
Other Goblins you control get +1/+1.
Sacrifice a Goblin: Destroy target artifact.
cards.flavor: "Folks 'round here are too in love with their contraptions. Does them some good if we smash one every so often."

rulings.text: Because damage remains marked on a creature until it's removed as the turn ends, nonlethal damage dealt to a Goblin you control may become lethal if Goblin Trashmaster leaves the battlefield during that turn.
You can sacrifice Goblin Trashmaster to pay the cost for its own ability.

cards.originalText:
Other Goblins you control get +1/+1.
Sacrifice a Goblin: Destroy target artifact.

cards.name: Guttersnipe
cards.text: Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell, Guttersnipe deals 2 damage to each opponent.
cards.flavor: "I found a new toy. Wanna play?"

rulings.text: Guttersnipe's triggered ability resolves before the spell that caused it to trigger. It resolves even if that spell is countered.
In a Two-Headed Giant game, Guttersnipe's ability causes the opposing team to lose 4 life.

cards.originalText: Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell, Guttersnipe deals 2 damage to each opponent.

cards.name: Havoc Devils
cards.text: Trample (This creature can deal excess combat damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.)
cards.flavor: For devils, burning things is the highest form of comedy, diversion, and artistic expression.
cards.originalText: Trample (This creature can deal excess combat damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.)

cards.name: Hostile Minotaur
cards.text: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
cards.flavor: The bellow of a minotaur always translates to "charge."

foreignNames.name: 敵意あるミノタウルス

cards.originalText: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)

cards.name: Inferno Hellion
cards.text:
Trample (This creature can deal excess combat damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.)
At the beginning of each end step, if Inferno Hellion attacked or blocked this turn, its owner shuffles it into their library.

rulings.text: Inferno Hellion's owner shuffles it into their library only if it's on the battlefield as its last ability resolves.

cards.originalText: Trample (This creature can deal excess combat damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.) At the beginning of each end step, if Inferno Hellion attacked or blocked this turn, its owner shuffles it into their library.

cards.name: Lathliss, Dragon Queen
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever another nontoken Dragon enters the battlefield under your control, create a 5/5 red Dragon creature token with flying.
{1}{R}: Dragons you control get +1/+0 until end of turn.

foreignNames.name: ドラゴンの女王、ラスリス

cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever another nontoken Dragon enters the battlefield under your control, create a 5/5 red Dragon creature token with flying.
{1}{R}: Dragons you control get +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Lava Axe
cards.text: Lava Axe deals 5 damage to target player or planeswalker.
cards.flavor: "Catch!"
cards.originalText: Lava Axe deals 5 damage to target player or planeswalker.

cards.name: Lightning Mare
cards.text:
This spell can't be countered.
Lightning Mare can't be blocked by blue creatures.
{1}{R}: Lightning Mare gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: When it passes, storm clouds bolt across the land.
cards.originalText:
This spell can't be countered.
Lightning Mare can't be blocked by blue creatures.
{1}{R}: Lightning Mare gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Lightning Strike
cards.text: Lightning Strike deals 3 damage to any target.
cards.flavor: To wield lightning is to tame chaos.
cards.originalText: Lightning Strike deals 3 damage to any target.

cards.name: Onakke Ogre
cards.flavor: The ogres you know are nothing like the Onakke. Possessing both intellect and industry, they had brute strength without being brutish.

cards.name: Sarkhan, Fireblood
cards.text:
+1: You may discard a card. If you do, draw a card.
+1: Add two mana in any combination of colors. Spend this mana only to cast Dragon spells.
−7: Create four 5/5 red Dragon creature tokens with flying.

rulings.text: Because it's a loyalty ability, Sarkhan's second ability isn't a mana ability. It can be activated only any time you could cast a sorcery. It uses the stack and can be responded to.
A "Dragon spell" refers only to a spell that has the Dragon subtype, regardless of its name. For example, Dragon's Hoard isn't a Dragon spell.

cards.originalText:
+1: You may discard a card. If you do, draw a card.
+1: Add two mana in any combination of colors. Spend this mana only to cast Dragon spells.
−7: Create four 5/5 red Dragon creature tokens with flying.

cards.name: Sarkhan's Unsealing
cards.text:
Whenever you cast a creature spell with power 4, 5, or 6, Sarkhan's Unsealing deals 4 damage to any target.
Whenever you cast a creature spell with power 7 or greater, Sarkhan's Unsealing deals 4 damage to each opponent and each creature and planeswalker they control.

rulings.text: If you cast a creature spell that will enter the battlefield with a number of +1/+1 counters, such as Hungering Hydra, those counters aren't considered when determining whether either ability of Sarkhan's Unsealing triggers. Similarly, effects that will raise the creature's power once it has entered the battlefield won't apply.
Each of the triggered abilities of Sarkhan's Unsealing resolves before the spell that caused it to trigger. It resolves even if that spell is countered.

If a creature card's power is written as * and an ability defines its power, that ability applies while the creature spell is on the stack. Sarkhan's unsealing checks its power only as you finish paying costs; it doesn't matter what the spell's power is as you begin to cast it or when the triggered ability resolves.
In a Two-Headed Giant game, the last ability of Sarkhan's Unsealing causes the opposing team to lose 8 life.

cards.originalText:
Whenever you cast a creature spell with power 4, 5, or 6, Sarkhan's Unsealing deals 4 damage to any target.
Whenever you cast a creature spell with power 7 or greater, Sarkhan's Unsealing deals 4 damage to each opponent and each creature and planeswalker they control.

cards.name: Shock
cards.text: Shock deals 2 damage to any target.
cards.flavor: The tools of invention became the weapons of revolution.
cards.originalText: Shock deals 2 damage to any target.

cards.name: Siegebreaker Giant
cards.text:
Trample (This creature can deal excess combat damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.)
{3}{R}: Target creature can't block this turn.
cards.flavor: No rampart can withstand the fury of a giant.

rulings.text: Activating Siegebreaker Giant's last ability after a creature has blocked won't remove the blocking creature from combat or cause the creature it blocked to become unblocked.

cards.originalText: Trample (This creature can deal excess combat damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.) {3}{R}: Target creature can't block this turn.

cards.name: Smelt
cards.text: Destroy target artifact.
cards.flavor: The creation of new weapons demands the destruction of others.
cards.originalText: Destroy target artifact.

cards.name: Sparktongue Dragon
cards.text:
Flying
When Sparktongue Dragon enters the battlefield, you may pay {2}{R}. When you do, it deals 3 damage to any target.
cards.flavor: Fools believe that Kolaghan's brood follows lightning storms. The wise know that it is the other way around.

rulings.text: Sparktongue Dragon's triggered ability goes on the stack without a target. While that ability is resolving, you may pay {2}{R}. If you do, a second ability triggers and you pick a target that will be dealt damage. This is different from abilities that say "If you do . . ." in that players may cast spells and activate abilities after mana is paid but before damage is dealt.
While resolving the triggered ability of Sparktongue Dragon, you can't pay {2}{R} multiple times to have it deal more than 3 damage.

cards.originalText:
Flying
When Sparktongue Dragon enters the battlefield, you may pay {2}{R}. When you do, it deals 3 damage to any target.

cards.name: Spit Flame
cards.text:
Spit Flame deals 4 damage to target creature.
Whenever a Dragon enters the battlefield under your control, you may pay {R}. If you do, return Spit Flame from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.originalText:
Spit Flame deals 4 damage to target creature.
Whenever a Dragon enters the battlefield under your control, you may pay {R}. If you do, return Spit Flame from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Sure Strike
cards.text: Target creature gets +3/+0 and gains first strike until end of turn. (It deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
cards.flavor: To survive imminent doom, it sometimes takes a foolhardy soul who acts first and fears later.
cards.originalText: Target creature gets +3/+0 and gains first strike until end of turn. (It deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)

cards.name: Tectonic Rift
cards.text: Destroy target land. Creatures without flying can't block this turn.
cards.flavor:
"You will kneel before me, even if I have to split the earth under your feet!"
—Ash Kronor, Keldon warlord

rulings.text: If the land is an illegal target when Tectonic Rift tries to resolve, Tectonic Rift won't resolve and none of its effects will happen. Creatures without flying will be able to block as normal.

Because the second part of Tectonic Rift's effect doesn't change the characteristics of any permanents, the set of creatures affected by it is constantly updated. Creatures without flying that enter the battlefield later in the turn can't block, and creatures that gain flying later in the turn can block.

cards.originalText: Destroy target land. Creatures without flying can't block this turn.

cards.name: Thud
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice a creature.
Thud deals damage equal to the sacrificed creature's power to any target.
cards.flavor:
"Give 'em a push."
—Mogwin, goblin delinquent

rulings.text: The sacrificed creature's last known existence on the battlefield is checked to determine its power.
You must sacrifice exactly one creature to cast Thud; you can't cast it without sacrificing a creature, and you can't sacrifice additional creatures.
Players can respond only once Thud has been cast and all its costs have been paid. No one can try to destroy the creature you sacrificed to prevent you from casting this spell.

cards.originalText:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice a creature.
Thud deals damage equal to the sacrificed creature's power to any target.

cards.name: Tormenting Voice
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, discard a card.
Draw two cards.
cards.flavor:
"Unwelcome thoughts crowd my mind. Are they my own madness, or the whispers of another?"
—Sarkhan Vol

rulings.text: You must discard exactly one card to cast Tormenting Voice; you can't cast it without discarding a card, and you can't discard additional cards.

cards.originalText:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, discard a card.
Draw two cards.

cards.name: Trumpet Blast
cards.text: Attacking creatures get +2/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: The sound of the trumpets lights a fire in the hearts of the bold and snuffs the courage of the cowardly.

rulings.text: An "attacking creature" is one that has been declared as an attacker this combat, or one that was put onto the battlefield attacking this combat. Unless that creature leaves combat, it continues to be an attacking creature through the end of combat step, even if the player it was attacking has left the game, or the planeswalker it was attacking has left combat.
Even though Trumpet Blast affects only attacking creatures, the bonus will remain for the rest of the turn.
Only creatures that are attacking as Trumpet Blast resolves will receive the bonus. In other words, casting it before you've declared attackers usually won't do anything.

cards.originalText: Attacking creatures get +2/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Viashino Pyromancer
cards.text: When Viashino Pyromancer enters the battlefield, it deals 2 damage to target player or planeswalker.
cards.flavor: "I trained with the Ghitu, and I respect the fire as they do."

foreignNames.name: ヴィーアシーノの紅蓮術師

cards.originalText: When Viashino Pyromancer enters the battlefield, it deals 2 damage to target player or planeswalker.

cards.name: Volcanic Dragon
cards.text:
Flying
Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
cards.flavor: Sometimes an eruption in Shiv produces something more dangerous than a mere river of molten rock.

cards.name: Volley Veteran
cards.text: When Volley Veteran enters the battlefield, it deals damage to target creature an opponent controls equal to the number of Goblins you control.
cards.flavor: "Fill the sky with stuff!"

rulings.text: The number of Goblins you control is counted only as Volley Veteran's ability resolves. If Volley Veteran is still on the battlefield, it will count itself.

cards.originalText: When Volley Veteran enters the battlefield, it deals damage to target creature an opponent controls equal to the number of Goblins you control.

Enchant creature

Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 for each Forest you control.

cards.name: Bristling Boar
cards.text: Bristling Boar can't be blocked by more than one creature.
cards.flavor:
"Nicol Bolas destroyed my world. I owe it to Skalla to celebrate all life, no matter how dangerous."
—Vivien Reid

rulings.text: If Bristling Boar gains menace, it can't be blocked at all.

cards.originalText: Bristling Boar can't be blocked by more than one creature.

cards.name: Centaur Courser
cards.flavor:
"The centaurs are truly free. Never will they be tamed by temptation or controlled by fear. They live in total harmony, a feat not yet achieved by our kind."
—Ramal, sage of Westgate

foreignNames.name: ケンタウルスの狩猟者

cards.name: Colossal Dreadmaw
cards.text: Trample (This creature can deal excess combat damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.)
cards.flavor: If you feel the ground quake, run. If you hear its bellow, flee. If you see its teeth, it's too late.
cards.originalText: Trample (This creature can deal excess combat damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.)

cards.name: Colossal Majesty
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if you control a creature with power 4 or greater, draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"Might doesn't just build empires. It protects them."
—Inti, Sun Empire knight

rulings.text: If you don't control a creature with power 4 or greater as your upkeep begins, Colossal Majesty's ability won't trigger. You can't take any actions during your turn before your upkeep begins.
If you don't control a creature with power 4 or greater as Colossal Majesty's ability resolves, you won't draw a card.

The creature with power 4 or greater that you control as Colossal Majesty's ability resolves doesn't have to be the same creature with power 4 or greater that was under your control as the ability triggered.
You draw only one card, no matter how many creatures with power 4 or greater you control.

cards.originalText: At the beginning of your upkeep, if you control a creature with power 4 or greater, draw a card.

cards.name: Daggerback Basilisk
cards.text: Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)
cards.flavor: Its ventricles weep venom, and it consumes only poison.
cards.originalText: Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)

cards.name: Declare Dominance
cards.text: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn. All creatures able to block it this turn do so.
cards.flavor:
"If you think yourself a chief, then prove your might."
—Gar-Tun, Mistvalley silverback

rulings.text: If a creature the defending player controls can't block the target creature for any reason (such as being tapped), then it doesn't block that creature. If there's a cost associated with having a creature block the attacking creature, the defending player isn't forced to pay that cost, so it doesn't have to block in that case either.

cards.originalText: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn. All creatures able to block it this turn do so.

cards.name: Druid of Horns
cards.text: Whenever you cast an Aura spell that targets Druid of Horns, create a 3/3 green Beast creature token.
cards.flavor: No welcome for those who trespass. Only fang and horn and claw.

rulings.text: Druid of Horns's ability resolves before the spell that caused it to trigger. The ability resolves even if that spell is countered.

cards.originalText: Whenever you cast an Aura spell that targets Druid of Horns, create a 3/3 green Beast creature token.

cards.name: Druid of the Cowl
cards.text: {T}: Add {G}.
cards.flavor: "The wild tangle of the Cowl provides sanctuary to life that watched the first buildings rise."
cards.originalText: {T}: Add {G}.

cards.name: Dryad Greenseeker
cards.text: {T}: Look at the top card of your library. If it's a land card, you may reveal it and put it into your hand.
cards.flavor: "The land already knows its destiny. I simply ask it to share the tale with me."

rulings.text: If the top card of your library isn't a land card, or if you choose not to reveal it, it remains on top of your library.

cards.originalText: {T}: Look at the top card of your library. If it's a land card, you may reveal it and put it into your hand.

cards.name: Elvish Clancaller
cards.text:
Other Elves you control get +1/+1.
{4}{G}{G}, {T}: Search your library for a card named Elvish Clancaller, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: No single root feeds the forest.
cards.originalText:
Other Elves you control get +1/+1.
{4}{G}{G}, {T}: Search your library for a card named Elvish Clancaller, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Elvish Rejuvenator
cards.text: When Elvish Rejuvenator enters the battlefield, look at the top five cards of your library. You may put a land card from among them onto the battlefield tapped. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in a random order.
cards.originalText: When Elvish Rejuvenator enters the battlefield, look at the top five cards of your library. You may put a land card from among them onto the battlefield tapped. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in a random order.

cards.name: Ghastbark Twins
cards.text:
Trample (This creature can deal excess combat damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.)
Ghastbark Twins can block an additional creature each combat.
cards.flavor: They grow closer with every passing season.
cards.originalText: Trample (This creature can deal excess combat damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.) Ghastbark Twins can block an additional creature each combat.

cards.name: Ghirapur Guide
cards.text: {2}{G}: Target creature you control can't be blocked by creatures with power 2 or less this turn.
cards.flavor: Fairgoers were delighted to find that even outside the fairgrounds, Ghirapur was a city of wonders.

rulings.text: Once a creature with power 2 or less has blocked a creature, activating Ghirapur Guide's ability won't change or undo that block.
Once a creature with power 3 or greater has blocked the target creature, changing the power of the blocking creature won't change or undo that block.

cards.originalText: {2}{G}: Target creature you control can't be blocked by creatures with power 2 or less this turn.

cards.name: Giant Spider
cards.text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
cards.flavor:
"After everything I've survived, it's hard to be frightened by anything anymore."
—Vivien Reid

rulings.text: This card now uses the Reach keyword ability to enable the blocking of flying creatures. This works because a creature with flying can only be blocked by creatures with flying or reach.

cards.originalText: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)

cards.name: Gift of Paradise
cards.text:
Enchant land
When Gift of Paradise enters the battlefield, you gain 3 life.
Enchanted land has "{T}: Add two mana of any one color."
cards.originalText:
Enchant land
When Gift of Paradise enters the battlefield, you gain 3 life.
Enchanted land has "{T}: Add two mana of any one color."

cards.name: Gigantosaurus
cards.flavor:
"Each tooth is the length of a horse, and new ones grow in every sixteen days. Let's get a closer look!"
—Vivien Reid

cards.name: Goreclaw, Terror of Qal Sisma
cards.text:
Creature spells you cast with power 4 or greater cost {2} less to cast.
Whenever Goreclaw, Terror of Qal Sisma attacks, each creature you control with power 4 or greater gets +1/+1 and gains trample until end of turn.
cards.flavor: You don't want to know how she got that name.

rulings.text: If you cast a creature spell that will enter the battlefield with a number of +1/+1 counters, such as Hungering Hydra, those counters aren't considered when determining whether Goreclaw reduces that spell's cost. Similarly, effects that will raise the creature's power once it has entered the battlefield won't apply.
If another creature has an ability that changes its power when it attacks, such as Brawl-Bash Ogre, you may have that ability resolve before Goreclaw's last ability.

Goreclaw's last ability affects only creatures you control with the appropriate power at the time it resolves. Creatures you begin to control later in the turn won't get either bonus, and a creature you control whose power decreases later in the turn won't lose either bonus.

foreignNames.name: カル・シスマの恐怖、殺し爪
Garra Cruenta, Terror de Qal Sisma

cards.originalText:
Creature spells you cast with power 4 or greater cost {2} less to cast.
Whenever Goreclaw, Terror of Qal Sisma attacks, each creature you control with power 4 or greater gets +1/+1 and gains trample until end of turn.

cards.name: Greenwood Sentinel
cards.text: Vigilance (Attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)
cards.flavor: Within a mile of the woodland, you will feel her eyes upon you. Within its borders, you will feel her blade.
cards.originalText: Vigilance (Attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)

cards.name: Highland Game
cards.text: When Highland Game dies, you gain 2 life.
cards.flavor:
"Bring down a stag and fix its horns upon Arel's head. She hears the wisdom of our ancestors."
—Chianul, Who Whispers Twice
cards.originalText: When Highland Game dies, you gain 2 life.

cards.name: Hungering Hydra
cards.text:
Hungering Hydra enters the battlefield with X +1/+1 counters on it.
Hungering Hydra can't be blocked by more than one creature.
Whenever Hungering Hydra is dealt damage, put that many +1/+1 counters on it. (It must survive the damage to get the counters.)
cards.originalText: Hungering Hydra enters the battlefield with X +1/+1 counters on it. Hungering Hydra can't be blocked by more than one creature. Whenever Hungering Hydra is dealt damage, put that many +1/+1 counters on it. (It must survive the damage to get the counters.)

cards.name: Naturalize
cards.text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
cards.flavor:
"And if you threaten me again, your shiny steel trousers will be sprouting daggerthorn vines."
—Iveta, rooftop runner
cards.originalText: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.

cards.name: Oakenform
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +3/+3.
cards.flavor:
"When the beast cloaks itself in the mighty oak, what good is a bow? When the oak wraps itself around the snarling beast, what good is a hatchet?"
—Dionus, elvish archdruid
cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +3/+3.

cards.name: Pelakka Wurm
cards.text:
Trample
When Pelakka Wurm enters the battlefield, you gain 7 life.
When Pelakka Wurm dies, draw a card.
cards.flavor: It eats what it wants to eat—which is anything that moves.
cards.originalText:
Trample
When Pelakka Wurm enters the battlefield, you gain 7 life.
When Pelakka Wurm dies, draw a card.

cards.name: Plummet
cards.text: Destroy target creature with flying.
cards.flavor:
"Let nothing own the skies but the wind."
—Dejara, Giltwood druid
cards.originalText: Destroy target creature with flying.

cards.name: Prodigious Growth
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +7/+7 and has trample.
cards.flavor:
"Look how cute it is now!"
—Vivien Reid
cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +7/+7 and has trample.

cards.name: Rabid Bite
cards.text: Target creature you control deals damage equal to its power to target creature you don't control.
cards.flavor: "You should have seen the look on both their faces." —Morkamp, Lambholt innkeeper

rulings.text: If either creature is an illegal target as Rabid Bite tries to resolve, the creature you control won't deal damage.

cards.originalText: Target creature you control deals damage equal to its power to target creature you don't control.

cards.name: Reclamation Sage
cards.text: When Reclamation Sage enters the battlefield, you may destroy target artifact or enchantment.
cards.flavor: "What was once formed by masons, shaped by smiths, or given life by mages, I will return to the embrace of the earth."
cards.originalText: When Reclamation Sage enters the battlefield, you may destroy target artifact or enchantment.

cards.name: Recollect
cards.text: Return target card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: "The bones of the past will tell their tales—if you know how to speak their language."
cards.originalText: Return target card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Rhox Oracle
cards.text: When Rhox Oracle enters the battlefield, draw a card.
cards.flavor: "The further into the future I look, the less certain my vision. Even now, the middle distance is obscured by fire."
cards.originalText: When Rhox Oracle enters the battlefield, draw a card.

cards.name: Root Snare
cards.text: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.
cards.flavor: The only casualties were a snapped spear, a lost helmet, and some bruised egos.
cards.originalText: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.

cards.name: Runic Armasaur
cards.text: Whenever an opponent activates an ability of a creature or land that isn't a mana ability, you may draw a card.
cards.flavor: The Sun Empire's most sacred sites are protected by more than prayers.

rulings.text: Activated abilities contain a colon. They're generally written "[Cost]: [Effect]." Some keyword abilities are activated abilities and will have colons in their reminder text. An activated mana ability is one that produces mana as it resolves, not one that costs mana to activate.

Runic Armasaur's ability doesn't trigger when an opponent activates an ability of a card in hand (such as a cycling ability from the Amonkhet block) or a card in a graveyard (such as that of Bone Dragon), even if that causes a card to be put onto the battlefield.
Runic Armasaur's ability doesn't trigger when an opponent activates an ability of a noncreature, nonland permanent that causes it to become a creature (such as a crew ability of a Vehicle).

Runic Armasaur's ability resolves before the ability that caused it to trigger. Players can cast spells and activate abilities after the triggered ability resolves but before the activated ability that caused it to trigger does.

foreignNames.name: 秘紋のアルマサウルス

cards.originalText: Whenever an opponent activates an ability of a creature or land that isn't a mana ability, you may draw a card.

cards.name: Scapeshift
cards.text: Sacrifice any number of lands. Search your library for up to that many land cards, put them onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: "Whether we like it or not, our arrival has altered the landscape." —Malcolm, navigator of the Belligerent

rulings.text: You sacrifice the lands as part of the resolution of Scapeshift. It isn't an additional cost. If Scapeshift is countered, you won't sacrifice any lands.

cards.originalText: Sacrifice any number of lands. Search your library for up to that many land cards, put them onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Talons of Wildwood
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 and has trample. (It can deal excess combat damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.)
{2}{G}: Return Talons of Wildwood from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.originalText: Enchant creature Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 and has trample. (It can deal excess combat damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.) {2}{G}: Return Talons of Wildwood from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Thorn Lieutenant
cards.text:
Whenever Thorn Lieutenant becomes the target of a spell or ability an opponent controls, create a 1/1 green Elf Warrior creature token.
{5}{G}: Thorn Lieutenant gets +4/+4 until end of turn.

rulings.text: Thorn Lieutenant's triggered ability resolves before the spell or ability that caused it to trigger. It resolves even if that spell or ability is countered.

cards.originalText:
Whenever Thorn Lieutenant becomes the target of a spell or ability an opponent controls, create a 1/1 green Elf Warrior creature token.
{5}{G}: Thorn Lieutenant gets +4/+4 until end of turn.

cards.name: Thornhide Wolves
cards.flavor:
"Halana grew brambles to create a barricade around our camp, hoping that it would keep the wolves out. That was a mistake for which we almost paid dearly."
—Alena, trapper of Kessig

cards.name: Titanic Growth
cards.text: Target creature gets +4/+4 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: The massive dominate through might. The tiny survive with guile. Beware the tiny who become massive.
cards.originalText: Target creature gets +4/+4 until end of turn.

cards.name: Vigilant Baloth
cards.text: Vigilance (Attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)
cards.flavor: Villagers employ watchdogs as guardians and companions. Druids prefer something a little bigger.
cards.originalText: Vigilance (Attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)

cards.name: Vine Mare
cards.text:
Hexproof (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)
Vine Mare can't be blocked by black creatures.
cards.flavor: When it passes, the dead are displaced by flourishing life.
cards.originalText: Hexproof (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.) Vine Mare can't be blocked by black creatures.

cards.name: Vivien Reid
cards.text:
+1: Look at the top four cards of your library. You may reveal a creature or land card from among them and put it into your hand. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in a random order.
−3: Destroy target artifact, enchantment, or creature with flying.
−8: You get an emblem with "Creatures you control get +2/+2 and have vigilance, trample, and indestructible."
cards.originalText:
+1: Look at the top four cards of your library. You may reveal a creature or land card from among them and put it into your hand. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in a random order.
−3: Destroy target artifact, enchantment, or creature with flying.
−8: You get an emblem with "Creatures you control get +2/+2 and have vigilance, trample, and indestructible."

cards.name: Vivien's Invocation
cards.text: Look at the top seven cards of your library. You may put a creature card from among them onto the battlefield. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in a random order. When a creature is put onto the battlefield this way, it deals damage equal to its power to target creature an opponent controls.

rulings.text: You don't choose any targets as you cast Vivien's Invocation. While that spell is resolving, you may put a creature card from among the cards you look at onto the battlefield. If you do, a separate ability triggers and you pick a target creature an opponent controls to be dealt damage.

If the creature you put onto the battlefield leaves the battlefield before damage is dealt, its last known existence on the battlefield is used to determine how much damage it deals to the target creature.

cards.originalText: Look at the top seven cards of your library. You may put a creature card from among them onto the battlefield. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in a random order. When a creature is put onto the battlefield this way, it deals damage equal to its power to target creature an opponent controls.

cards.name: Wall of Vines
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
cards.flavor: Like all jungle plants, the vines must fight and claw for sunlight. Once their place is secured, they grow strong, sharp, and impenetrable.
cards.originalText: Defender (This creature can't attack.) Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)

cards.name: Aerial Engineer
cards.text: As long as you control an artifact, Aerial Engineer gets +2/+0 and has flying.
cards.flavor: The best of their trade know every bolt of their rigs, stem to stern.
cards.originalText: As long as you control an artifact, Aerial Engineer gets +2/+0 and has flying.

cards.name: Arcades, the Strategist
cards.text:
Flying, vigilance
Whenever a creature with defender enters the battlefield under your control, draw a card.
Each creature you control with defender assigns combat damage equal to its toughness rather than its power and can attack as though it didn't have defender.

rulings.text: Arcades's last ability doesn't actually change any creature's power. It changes only the amount of combat damage it assigns. All other rules and effects that check power or toughness use the real values. For example, Rabid Bite won't cause a creature to deal damage equal to its toughness.
If Arcades leaves the battlefield after a creature with defender has attacked, that creature remains an attacking creature, although it will assign damage equal to its power.

cards.originalText:
Flying, vigilance
Whenever a creature with defender enters the battlefield under your control, draw a card.
Each creature you control with defender assigns combat damage equal to its toughness rather than its power and can attack as though it didn't have defender.

cards.name: Brawl-Bash Ogre
cards.text:
Menace (This creature can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)
Whenever Brawl-Bash Ogre attacks, you may sacrifice another creature. If you do, Brawl-Bash Ogre gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

rulings.text: While resolving the triggered ability of Brawl-Bash Ogre, you can't sacrifice multiple creatures to give it +2/+2 more than once.

Once Brawl-Bash Ogre's triggered ability begins to resolve, no player may take actions until it's done. Notably, players can't try to deal damage to Brawl-Bash Ogre after you've sacrificed a creature but before it gets +2/+2.

cards.originalText: Menace (This creature can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.) Whenever Brawl-Bash Ogre attacks, you may sacrifice another creature. If you do, Brawl-Bash Ogre gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Chromium, the Mutable
cards.text:
Flash
This spell can't be countered.
Flying
Discard a card: Until end of turn, Chromium, the Mutable becomes a Human with base power and toughness 1/1, loses all abilities, and gains hexproof. It can't be blocked this turn.

rulings.text: Chromium stops being an Elder Dragon for the turn once its last ability has resolved. It's still a legendary creature named Chromium, the Mutable.

Chromium's activated ability overwrites all previous effects that set its base power and toughness to specific values. Any power- or toughness-setting effects that start to apply after that ability resolves will overwrite this effect.

Effects that raise or lower a creature's power and/or toughness, such as the effect of Titanic Growth, will apply to the creature no matter when they started to take effect. The same is true for any counters that change its power and/or toughness and effects that switch its power and toughness.
If Chromium gains an ability after its activated ability resolves, it will keep that ability.
Activating Chromium's last ability after it has become blocked won't cause Chromium to become unblocked.

cards.originalText:
Flash
This spell can't be countered.
Flying
Discard a card: Until end of turn, Chromium, the Mutable becomes a Human with base power and toughness 1/1, loses all abilities, and gains hexproof. It can't be blocked this turn.

cards.name: Draconic Disciple
cards.text:
{T}: Add one mana of any color.
{7}, {T}, Sacrifice Draconic Disciple: Create a 5/5 red Dragon creature token with flying.
cards.flavor: "If I am to die, I will die in the embrace of immeasurable flame."
cards.originalText:
{T}: Add one mana of any color.
{7}, {T}, Sacrifice Draconic Disciple: Create a 5/5 red Dragon creature token with flying.

cards.name: Enigma Drake
cards.text:
Flying
Enigma Drake's power is equal to the number of instant and sorcery cards in your graveyard.
cards.flavor: Many initiates believe it possesses secrets beyond imagining. Many have become meals trying to learn them.

rulings.text: A split card (such as those featured in the Amonkhet block) only counts once for Enigma Drake's ability, even if it's both an instant and a sorcery.
The ability that defines Enigma Drake's power works in all zones.

cards.originalText:
Flying
Enigma Drake's power is equal to the number of instant and sorcery cards in your graveyard.

cards.name: Heroic Reinforcements
cards.text: Create two 1/1 white Soldier creature tokens. Until end of turn, creatures you control get +1/+1 and gain haste. (They can attack and {T} this turn.)
cards.flavor: Cries of anguish quickly spurred cries of action.

rulings.text: The second part of Heroic Reinforcements's effect affects only creatures you control at the time it's applied, including the tokens created by the first part of its effect. Creatures you begin to control later in the turn won't get +1/+1 or gain haste.

cards.originalText: Create two 1/1 white Soldier creature tokens. Until end of turn, creatures you control get +1/+1 and gain haste. (They can attack and {T} this turn.)

cards.name: Nicol Bolas, the Ravager
cards.text:
Flying
When Nicol Bolas, the Ravager enters the battlefield, each opponent discards a card.
{4}{U}{B}{R}: Exile Nicol Bolas, the Ravager, then return him to the battlefield transformed under his owner's control. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.

rulings.text: When Nicol Bolas's enters-the-battlefield triggered ability resolves, first the next opponent in turn order (or, if it's an opponent's turn, that opponent) chooses a card in their hand without revealing it, then each other opponent in turn order does the same. Then all the chosen cards are discarded at the same time.

If Nicol Bolas leaves the battlefield after his creature face's activated ability has been activated but before it resolves, the card remains in whichever zone it moves to. It won't be exiled or return transformed.

Each face of a double-faced card has its own set of characteristics: name, types, subtypes, abilities, and so on. While a double-faced card is on the battlefield, consider only the characteristics of the face that's currently up. The other set of characteristics is ignored.

While a double-faced card isn't on the battlefield, consider only the characteristics of its front face. For example, Nicol Bolas has the characteristics of its creature face in the graveyard, even if it was a planeswalker on the battlefield before it was put into the graveyard.

A double-faced card enters the battlefield with its front face up by default, unless a spell or ability instructs you to put it onto the battlefield transformed, in which case it enters with its back face up. The back face of a double-faced card can't be played.

If another permanent that isn't a double-faced card (such as Mirror Image) becomes a copy of Nicol Bolas, the Ravager, activating the ability to exile it and return it transformed will only exile it. It won't return to the battlefield at all.

foreignNames.name: 破滅の龍、ニコル・ボーラス

cards.originalText:
Flying
When Nicol Bolas, the Ravager enters the battlefield, each opponent discards a card.
{4}{U}{B}{R}: Exile Nicol Bolas, the Ravager, then return him to the battlefield transformed under his owner's control. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.

cards.name: Nicol Bolas, the Arisen
cards.text:
+2: Draw two cards.
−3: Nicol Bolas, the Arisen deals 10 damage to target creature or planeswalker.
−4: Put target creature or planeswalker card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control.
−12: Exile all but the bottom card of target player's library.

rulings.text: In a multiplayer game, if a player leaves the game, all cards that player owns leave as well. If you leave the game, any permanents you control from Nicol Bolas's third loyalty ability that came from other players' graveyards are exiled.

The converted mana cost of a double-faced card is the converted mana cost of its front face, even while it's on the battlefield with its back face up. For example, the converted mana cost of Nicol Bolas, the Arisen is 4.
Nicol Bolas, the Arisen has a color indicator on its typeline. This color indicator means that it's a blue, black, and red permanent.
You can activate one of the planeswalker's loyalty abilities the turn it enters the battlefield.

In some rare cases, a spell or ability may cause Nicol Bolas to transform while it's a creature on the battlefield. If this happens, the resulting planeswalker won't have any loyalty counters on it and will subsequently be put into its owner's graveyard.

foreignNames.name: 覚醒の龍、ニコル・ボーラス

cards.originalText:
+2: Draw two cards.
−3: Nicol Bolas, the Arisen deals 10 damage to target creature or planeswalker.
−4: Put target creature or planeswalker card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control.
−12: Exile all but the bottom card of target player's library.

cards.name: Palladia-Mors, the Ruiner
cards.text:
Flying, vigilance, trample
Palladia-Mors, the Ruiner has hexproof if it hasn't dealt damage yet.
cards.flavor: Sister of Nicol Bolas. Survivor of the Elder Dragon War. The most vicious of her kin.

rulings.text: If Palladia-Mors leaves the battlefield and returns, it's considered a new object, even if it's represented by the same card. It has hexproof again until it deals damage.
If a triggered ability triggers at the same time that Paladia-Mors deals damage for the first time, targets are chosen for that ability after Palladia-Mors no longer has hexproof.

foreignNames.name: 殲滅の龍、パラディア＝モルス

cards.originalText:
Flying, vigilance, trample
Palladia-Mors, the Ruiner has hexproof if it hasn't dealt damage yet.

cards.name: Poison-Tip Archer
cards.text:
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)
Whenever another creature dies, each opponent loses 1 life.

rulings.text: If another creature dies at the same time as Poison-Tip Archer does, each opponent loses 1 life.
In a Two-Headed Giant game, Poison-tip Archer's last ability causes the opposing team to lose 2 life.

cards.originalText: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.) Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.) Whenever another creature dies, each opponent loses 1 life.

cards.name: Psychic Symbiont
cards.text:
Flying
When Psychic Symbiont enters the battlefield, target opponent discards a card and you draw a card.
cards.flavor: "I turn around and see nothing, yet I know it is behind me. Its fingers rummage in my mind, crafting new ideas."

rulings.text: Psychic Symbiont's last ability can target an opponent with no cards in hand. You'll draw a card even if no opponent discards a card.

cards.originalText:
Flying
When Psychic Symbiont enters the battlefield, target opponent discards a card and you draw a card.

cards.name: Regal Bloodlord
cards.text:
Flying
At the beginning of each end step, if you gained life this turn, create a 1/1 black Bat creature token with flying.
cards.flavor: Those of esteemed birth earn a most esteemed death.

rulings.text: Regal Bloodlord's last ability checks if you gained life at any point during the turn. It doesn't matter if you also lost life or whether your life total is greater than it was at the beginning of the turn. It also doesn't matter whether Regal Bloodlord was on the battlefield when the life gain happened.
If you didn't gain life during the turn before the end step begins, Regal Bloodlord's last ability won't trigger at all. Gaining life during the end step won't cause the ability to trigger.
You create only one Bat token, no matter how much life you gained.
In a Two-Headed Giant game, life gained by your teammate won't satisfy Regal Bloodlord's last ability, even though it caused your team's life total to increase.

cards.originalText:
Flying
At the beginning of each end step, if you gained life this turn, create a 1/1 black Bat creature token with flying.

cards.name: Satyr Enchanter
cards.text: Whenever you cast an enchantment spell, draw a card.
cards.flavor: "The threads of magic that protect this place were woven by my will."

rulings.text: Satyr Enchanter's triggered ability resolves before the spell that caused it to trigger. It resolves even if that spell is countered.

cards.originalText: Whenever you cast an enchantment spell, draw a card.

cards.name: Skyrider Patrol
cards.text:
Flying
At the beginning of combat on your turn, you may pay {G}{U}. When you do, put a +1/+1 counter on another target creature you control, and that creature gains flying until end of turn.

rulings.text: Skyrider Patrol's triggered ability goes on the stack without a target. While that ability is resolving, you may pay {G}{U}. If you do, a second ability triggers and you pick a target creature. This is different from abilities that say "If you do . . ." in that players may cast spells and activate abilities after mana is paid but before the target receives a counter and flying.
While resolving the triggered ability of Skyrider Patrol, you can't pay {G}{U} multiple times to give more than one +1/+1 counter.

cards.originalText:
Flying
At the beginning of combat on your turn, you may pay {G}{U}. When you do, put a +1/+1 counter on another target creature you control, and that creature gains flying until end of turn.

cards.name: Vaevictis Asmadi, the Dire
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Vaevictis Asmadi, the Dire attacks, for each player, choose target permanent that player controls. Those players sacrifice those permanents. Each player who sacrificed a permanent this way reveals the top card of their library, then puts it onto the battlefield if it's a permanent card.

rulings.text: You must target one of your permanents to sacrifice as well.

Vaevictis's triggered ability resolves during the declare attackers step, before blockers are chosen. A creature targeted by its ability won't be around to block, and creatures put onto the battlefield with its ability may be able to do so.

If any of the target permanents aren't sacrificed (most likely because one of them became an illegal target, such as by gaining hexproof), that permanent's controller won't reveal the top card of their library or put it onto the battlefield.
If any player controls no permanents, Vaevictis's ability won't have sufficient legal targets, so it's removed from the stack without any effect.

cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever Vaevictis Asmadi, the Dire attacks, for each player, choose target permanent that player controls. Those players sacrifice those permanents. Each player who sacrificed a permanent this way reveals the top card of their library, then puts it onto the battlefield if it's a permanent card.

cards.name: Amulet of Safekeeping
cards.text:
Whenever you become the target of a spell or ability an opponent controls, counter that spell or ability unless its controller pays {1}.
Creature tokens get -1/-0.
cards.flavor: Whether it is magical, lucky, or merely old, it is cherished, and that gives it power.
cards.originalText:
Whenever you become the target of a spell or ability an opponent controls, counter that spell or ability unless its controller pays {1}.
Creature tokens get -1/-0.
